intro: Enterosora campbellii subsp. spongiosa, commonly known as the spongey enterosora, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spongy-textured leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as tropical forests. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, often displaying vibrant colors that attract pollinators. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
